required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise With or Without Electrical Stimulation in Cystic Fibrosis (Part I): Effects on Physical Fitness
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Exercise With or Without Electrical Stimulation in Physical Fitness in Cystic Fibrosis: an Integrated Vision (ECOMIRIN Study)

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to assess the effects of programmed exercise with or without electrical stimulation in the cardiorespiratory fitness, strength, functional capacity and agility in a group of young patients with Cystic Fibrosis: A randomized controlled trial comparing two interventions with a control group.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Two assessment points throughout the study: baseline and 8 weeks after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Changes in strength will be measured using a five repetition maximum test (5RM)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two assessment points throughout the study:baseline and 8 weeks after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in cardiorespiratory fitness will be measured using a cardiopulmonary exercise test (CPET)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two assessment points throughout the study:baseline and 8 weeks after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in pulmonary function will be measured using Spirometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two assessment points throughout the study:baseline and 8 weeks after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in physical activity levels will be measured using Physical Activity Questionnaire for Children and Adolescents (PAC-C or PAC-A)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two assessment points throughout the study:baseline and 8 weeks after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in quality of life will be measures with the Cystic Fibrosis-Questionnaire-Revised (CFQ-R)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One assessment point at baseline:baseline and 8 weeks after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The food consumption frequency will be measured using food frequency questionnaire (FFQ)

arm_group.description: This group will continue with regular visits to the specialist. This visits include recommendations to improve lifestyle.

This group will continue with regular visits to the specialist. This visits include recommendations to improve lifestyle. The exercise protocol includes a concurrent exercise intervention (strength training and aerobic training), 3 days a week, 60 minutes sessions.

This group will continue with regular visits to the specialist. This visits include recommendations to improve lifestyle. The exercise protocol includes a concurrent exercise intervention (strength training and aerobic training), 3 days a week, 60 minutes sessions. Additionally, this group will receive neuromuscular electrical stimulation (NMES) concomitant to the strength training.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of CF
- Age: 6-18 years old
- Signature of informed consent of legal guardian and patient.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Being a smoker
- Having had an exacerbation in the last 3 months
- Having undergone gastric surgery
- Having enteral nutrition at present
- The patients will come from the HIUNJ of Madrid.
- Currently taking CFTR modulators

facility.name: Escuela de Doctorado e Investigacion, Universidad Europea

responsible_party.investigator_title: Full Professor in Exercise Physiology, MD, PhD
